For millions of people around the globe, our airport is their first impression of Louisville, and I can think of no better way to introduce travelers to our community than Muhammad Ali and the values he embodied and fought for his entire life.

Renaming @FlyLouisville for Ali isn't only fitting because he seemed to fly when he was in the ring, but because even as he became perhaps the quintessential citizen of the world, Muhammad Ali remained a proud Louisvillian.
There are a lot of worthy people who could represent our city, but I am thrilled that the Airport Authority chose the greatest, @MuhammadAli.

The ongoing Texas v. U.S. lawsuit seeks to end the ACA and gut protections for pre-existing conditions & lifetime caps on care. I’m glad @HouseDemocrats voted to #ProtectOurCare and defend the ACA in the courts, and I’m proud of @kyoag for leading the legal fight on behalf of KY.
